title: Boosted?
body: I'm wondering if it counts as getting boosted if someoneX boosts someoneY  from bronze to diamond, for example, but someoneX has an ok winrate in diamond after that.

replies.body:
Boosting is generally defined as someone else playing on your account, for example, you giving me access to your account in order to play ranked games for you. If you aren't playing your own matches, there's an issue of account sharing which could compromise the security of your account first off, but there's also the fact that you achieved a certain rank, not from your own skill, but by having someone else do it for you. 

Having a decent winrate in the rank someone boosted you to doesn't make boosting okay.

I was just wondering, what if the person getting boosted is playing with a person who is boosting the person. To clarify it, if we call the person getting boosted B for bronze and the person who is boosting D for diamond, then its also not okay for B to play with D in ranked. Right?
Thank you for clarifying it for me :)
